name: Rosemary-Ginger Cocktail
author: SandyG
summary: Rosemary and ginger give both a piney taste and a little bite to these gin cocktails.
ingredients: ⅓ cup packed fresh rosemary leaves
⅓ cup coarsely chopped fresh ginger
directions: Bring all syrup ingredients to a boil in a small saucepan over medium heat
Boil, stirring until sugar has dissolve, about 1 minute
Let stand, covered, 1 hour at room temperature
Strain through a fine-mesh sieve, pushing down on solids to extract as much liquid as possible
Combine gin, 1 cup of the rosemary-ginger simple syrup, sparkling water, and lime juice in a cocktail shaker
Add ice cubes and shake until well-chilled
Strain 3/4 cup each into 8 glasses and serve
